stanza.line: Those parts of thee that the world eye doth viewview
Want nothing that the thought of hearts can mendmend
All tongues (the voice of souls) give thee that duedue
Uttering bare truth even so as foes commendcommend
Thy outward thus with outward praise is crownedcrowned
But those same tongues that give thee so thine ownown
In other accents do this praise confoundconfound
By seeing farther than the eye hath shownshown
They look into the beauty of thy mindmind
And that in guess they measure by thy deedsdeeds
Then churls their thoughts (although their eyes were kind)kind)
To thy fair flower add the rank smell of weedsweeds
But why thy odour matcheth not thy showshow
The soil is this that thou dost common growgrow
